title: Psalms Chapter 85 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Psalms chapter 85 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Psalms Chapter 85 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Psalms Chapter 85.

questions.question: According to Psalms 85:1, for whom is this Psalm written?
questions.correctAnswer: Sons of Korah
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:1 states that this Psalm is for the sons of Korah.

questions.question: What has the LORD done for the land according to Psalms 85:1?
options: Brought back the captivity of Jacob
questions.correctAnswer: Brought back the captivity of Jacob
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:1 says the LORD hath brought back the captivity of Jacob.

questions.question: According to Psalms 85:2, what has God done to the iniquity of His people?
questions.correctAnswer: Forgiven it
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:2 says God hath forgiven the iniquity of His people.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 85:3 says that God has taken away all His wrath.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:3 states that God hath taken away all His wrath.

questions.question: What does the psalmist ask God to do in Psalms 85:4?
options: Turn us and cause thine anger to cease
questions.correctAnswer: Turn us and cause thine anger to cease
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:4 asks God to turn us and cause His anger toward us to cease.

questions.question: According to Psalms 85:5, what question does the psalmist ask about God's anger?
options: Wilt thou be angry with us forever?
questions.correctAnswer: Wilt thou be angry with us forever?
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:5 asks if God will be angry with us forever and draw out His anger to all generations.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Psalms 85:6: "Wilt thou not ______ us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?"
questions.correctAnswer: revive
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:6 says, "Wilt thou not revive us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?"

questions.question: What does the psalmist request to see from the LORD in Psalms 85:7?
questions.correctAnswer: Mercy
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:7 requests God to show mercy and grant salvation.

questions.question: According to Psalms 85:8, what will God speak to His people?
questions.correctAnswer: Peace
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:8 says God will speak peace unto His people and saints.

questions.question: According to Psalms 85:9, to whom is salvation near?
questions.correctAnswer: Them that fear Him
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:9 states salvation is near to those that fear God.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 85:10 says that mercy and truth are enemies.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:10 says mercy and truth have met together, not that they are enemies.

questions.question: What two qualities "have kissed each other" according to Psalms 85:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Righteousness and peace
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:10 says righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

questions.question: From where shall truth spring according to Psalms 85:11?
questions.correctAnswer: Out of the earth
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:11 says truth shall spring out of the earth.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 85:12 promises that the land shall yield her increase.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:12 says the land shall yield her increase as the LORD gives that which is good.

questions.question: According to Psalms 85:13, what will righteousness do?
options: Go before God and set us in His way
questions.correctAnswer: Go before God and set us in His way
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:13 states righteousness shall go before God and set us in the way of His steps.

medium.title: Psalms Chapter 85 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Psalms Chapter 85 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with guilt over past sins. Based on Psalms 85, what biblical truth would you share about God's forgiveness?
options: God has forgiven the iniquity of His people and covered all their sin.
God will never forgive repeated mistakes.
God only forgives when we perform perfect works.
God forgets the sins but does not forgive.
questions.correctAnswer: God has forgiven the iniquity of His people and covered all their sin.
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:2 teaches that God has forgiven the iniquity of His people and covered all their sin, assuring believers of His mercy and forgiveness.

questions.question: How does Psalms 85 encourage believers to respond when facing God's anger for their sins?
options: Turn to God and ask Him to cease His anger.
Ignore God's anger and continue as before.
Try to appease anger through works alone.
questions.correctAnswer: Turn to God and ask Him to cease His anger.
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:4 invites believers to turn to God and request that His anger toward them cease, highlighting the importance of repentance and seeking God's mercy.

questions.question: What hope does Psalms 85 offer to believers who desire spiritual revival?
options: God will revive His people so they may rejoice in Him.
Spiritual revival depends only on personal effort.
Revival is impossible after certain sins.
questions.correctAnswer: God will revive His people so they may rejoice in Him.
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:6 expresses the plea for God to revive His people so that they may rejoice in Him, emphasizing God's power to restore joy and spiritual life.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged and asks about God's willingness to continue showing mercy. What assurance does Psalms 85 provide?
options: God’s mercy is near to those who fear Him.
God’s mercy is limited to the past only.
God’s mercy depends on human strength.
questions.correctAnswer: God’s mercy is near to those who fear Him.
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:9 assures believers that God’s salvation and mercy are near to those who fear Him, encouraging trust and reverence.

questions.question: How does Psalms 85 describe the relationship between mercy and truth?
options: Mercy and truth meet together; righteousness and peace kiss each other.
Mercy and truth are opposing forces.
questions.correctAnswer: Mercy and truth meet together; righteousness and peace kiss each other.
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:10 poetically describes mercy and truth as meeting together, and righteousness and peace as kissing, symbolizing harmony in God’s character.

questions.question: In practical Christian living, how does Psalms 85 teach us about the source of good things in our lives?
options: The LORD gives that which is good and causes the land to yield increase.
Good things come only from human effort.
Good things are unrelated to God’s will.
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD gives that which is good and causes the land to yield increase.
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:12 explains that the LORD provides good things and causes the land to produce, reminding believers to trust God as the ultimate source of blessing.

questions.question: A believer wants to understand how righteousness guides the Christian life. Based on Psalms 85, what would you tell them?
options: Righteousness goes before God and sets us in His steps.
Righteousness is only for religious leaders.
questions.correctAnswer: Righteousness goes before God and sets us in His steps.
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:13 describes righteousness as going before God and establishing the path for believers, emphasizing obedience and following God's ways.

questions.question: How does Psalms 85 instruct believers to listen to God’s guidance?
options: Hear what God the LORD will speak, for He speaks peace to His people.
Ignore God’s words and rely on human wisdom.
God does not speak to His people today.
questions.correctAnswer: Hear what God the LORD will speak, for He speaks peace to His people.
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:8 encourages believers to listen attentively to God’s voice because He speaks peace to His people, promoting trust and obedience.

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 85, God’s anger toward His people is everlasting and unchangeable.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:3-5 indicate that God has taken away His wrath and turned from His anger, questioning if He will be angry forever, thus showing His anger is not everlasting.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 85 teaches that peace and righteousness are interconnected and harmonious.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:10 describes righteousness and peace as kissing each other, symbolizing their harmony and interconnection in God's kingdom.

questions.question: A believer is feeling spiritually dry and asks what they should pray for according to Psalms 85. What is the best prayer to offer?
options: Pray for God’s mercy and salvation to be shown.
Pray to be left alone without trials.
questions.correctAnswer: Pray for God’s mercy and salvation to be shown.
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:7 encourages believers to seek God's mercy and salvation, which brings spiritual renewal and joy.

questions.question: How does Psalms 85 teach us about humility and repentance in our approach to God?
options: By turning to God and asking Him to turn us and cease His anger.
By boasting about our good deeds.
questions.correctAnswer: By turning to God and asking Him to turn us and cease His anger.
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:4 models humility and repentance as we ask God to turn us and cease His anger, showing dependence on His mercy.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "Truth shall spring out of the _____; and righteousness shall look down from heaven."
questions.correctAnswer: earth
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:11 states that truth will spring out of the earth and righteousness will look down from heaven, illustrating the union of divine and earthly realities.

questions.question: A member of your church is discouraged about walking in righteousness. How does Psalms 85 provide encouragement about God's role in our spiritual journey?
options: God goes before us in righteousness and sets us in His steps.
We must achieve righteousness without God's help.
Righteousness is only for the perfect.
God ignores the efforts of believers.
questions.correctAnswer: God goes before us in righteousness and sets us in His steps.
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:13 encourages believers by showing that righteousness precedes and guides us, indicating God’s active role in leading us.

questions.question: How does Psalms 85 instruct believers to maintain spiritual focus and avoid folly?
options: Listen to God's words of peace and do not turn back to folly.
Ignore God’s warnings and continue sinning.
questions.correctAnswer: Listen to God's words of peace and do not turn back to folly.
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:8 warns the saints to heed God’s message of peace and avoid returning to foolishness, emphasizing spiritual discipline.

hard.title: Psalms Chapter 85 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Psalms Chapter 85.

questions.question: In Psalms 85:1, what significant event does the psalmist credit the LORD with regarding Jacob?
options: Brought back the captivity of Jacob
questions.correctAnswer: Brought back the captivity of Jacob
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:1 explicitly states that the LORD has been favorable to the land and brought back the captivity of Jacob, indicating restoration from exile.

questions.question: Which two concepts are described as having 'kissed each other' in Psalms 85:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Righteousness and peace
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:10 poetically describes 'Mercy and truth' meeting and 'Righteousness and peace' kissing, symbolizing a harmonious divine restoration.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in Psalms 85:10 where 'Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other'?
questions.correctAnswer: Personification
questions.explanation: The abstract qualities are given human actions (meeting and kissing), showing personification in Psalms 85:10.

questions.question: According to Psalms 85:3, what has the LORD taken away from His people?
questions.correctAnswer: All thy wrath
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:3 states that the LORD has taken away all His wrath and turned from the fierceness of His anger toward the people.

questions.question: In Psalms 85:8, what will God the LORD speak to His people?
questions.correctAnswer: Peace
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:8 says the LORD will speak peace unto His people and to His saints.

questions.question: What is the request made of God in Psalms 85:7?
options: Shew us thy mercy, O LORD, and grant us thy salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Shew us thy mercy, O LORD, and grant us thy salvation
questions.explanation: The psalmist asks God to show mercy and grant salvation in Psalms 85:7, expressing trust in divine compassion.

questions.question: Which phrase from Psalms 85:12 suggests a theme of agricultural blessing and divine provision?
options: Our land shall yield her increase
Truth shall spring out of the earth
Mercy and truth are met together
questions.correctAnswer: Our land shall yield her increase
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:12 connects divine goodness with the land yielding increase, reflecting agricultural prosperity under God's blessing.

questions.question: How does Psalms 85:11's mention of 'Truth shall spring out of the earth' function as a typological foreshadowing in biblical literature?
options: It anticipates the coming of divine revelation and the Messiah
It refers to a literal spring in Israel
It symbolizes the creation of the world
It predicts the fall of Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: It anticipates the coming of divine revelation and the Messiah
questions.explanation: The imagery of truth springing from the earth is often interpreted as foreshadowing divine revelation and the Messiah's arrival, connecting Psalms 85:11 with New Testament themes.

questions.question: What is the significance of the psalm being assigned 'To the chief Musician, A Psalm for the sons of Korah' in Psalms 85:1?
options: It indicates the Levitical singers who performed temple worship
It is a reference to the kings of Israel
It suggests a prophetic message for the priests
It is a direction for private meditation
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates the Levitical singers who performed temple worship
questions.explanation: The sons of Korah were a guild of Levitical singers responsible for temple music, showing the psalm's liturgical use as in Psalms 85:1.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 85:5 expresses a hope that God's anger will last forever.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:5 asks rhetorically if God will be angry forever and draws out anger to generations, implying a hope that He will not.

questions.question: In Psalms 85:6, what is the intended result of God reviving His people?
options: That thy people may rejoice in thee
That the temple may be rebuilt
questions.correctAnswer: That thy people may rejoice in thee
questions.explanation: The psalmist asks God to revive the people so that they may rejoice in Him, emphasizing joy in divine restoration (Psalms 85:6).

questions.question: What is the parallelism found in Psalms 85:4 'Turn us, O God of our salvation, and cause thine anger toward us to cease'?
questions.correctAnswer: Synthetic parallelism
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:4 presents synthetic parallelism where the second line completes the thought of the first by asking for anger to cease after turning.

questions.question: Which Old Testament theme is reflected in the plea for forgiveness and restoration in Psalms 85:2-3?
options: The giving of the Law at Sinai
questions.correctAnswer: The covenantal mercy of God
questions.explanation: The psalm emphasizes God's forgiveness and turning away of wrath, reflecting His covenantal mercy towards Israel as in Psalms 85:2-3.

questions.question: How does Psalms 85:9's statement that 'his salvation is nigh them that fear him' reflect the Deuteronomic theology found elsewhere in Scripture?
options: It emphasizes the nearness of God's deliverance to the faithful
It predicts the exile of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes the nearness of God's deliverance to the faithful
questions.explanation: This verse echoes Deuteronomic themes where fearing God is linked to receiving salvation and blessing, emphasizing God's readiness to save those who revere Him.

questions.question: In Psalms 85:13, what role does righteousness play in relation to the LORD?
options: Righteousness goes before Him and sets us in His way
Righteousness is a burden to Him
Righteousness is separate from His path
questions.correctAnswer: Righteousness goes before Him and sets us in His way
questions.explanation: The verse depicts righteousness as a guide leading before the LORD, showing its role in directing the faithful in Psalms 85:13.

theological.title: Psalms Chapter 85 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Psalms Chapter 85 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Psalms 85:1, what has the LORD done for the land and the captivity of Jacob?
options: He has been favourable and brought back captivity
He has punished the land severely
He has ignored the people's pleas
He has scattered the people abroad
questions.correctAnswer: He has been favourable and brought back captivity
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:1 states that the LORD has been favourable to the land and has restored the captivity of Jacob, showing God's mercy and faithfulness to His people. This aligns with biblical themes of God’s restoration (Jeremiah 29:10, Isaiah 44:22, Ezra 1:1-4, and Luke 1:68).

questions.question: What is the Psalmist asking God to do regarding His anger in Psalms 85:4?
options: Turn us and cause thine anger toward us to cease
Increase His anger to discipline us
questions.correctAnswer: Turn us and cause thine anger toward us to cease
questions.explanation: The Psalmist petitions God for a turning, a repentance, and for His anger to cease as a sign of restoration (Psalms 85:4). This reflects the biblical call for God’s mercy and the cessation of judgment (Joel 2:13, Ezekiel 36:26, Isaiah 54:7-8, 2 Chronicles 7:14).

questions.question: Psalms 85:6 asks God, 'Wilt thou not revive us again.' What is the intended result of this revival?
options: That thy people may rejoice in thee
That thy people may be silent
That thy people may be punished
questions.correctAnswer: That thy people may rejoice in thee
questions.explanation: Revival here is connected to joy in God’s presence, a common biblical theme where restoration leads to rejoicing (Psalms 51:12, Isaiah 61:3, Nehemiah 8:10, Acts 3:19). The Psalmist desires spiritual renewal that fosters joy in God.

questions.question: In Psalms 85:8, what does the Psalmist say God will speak to His people?
questions.correctAnswer: Peace
questions.explanation: The Psalmist declares that God will speak peace to His people and saints, emphasizing God’s role as a bringer of peace (Numbers 6:26, Isaiah 9:6, John 14:27, Romans 5:1). Peace here is both a divine gift and an eschatological hope.

questions.question: What two attributes are described as meeting and kissing in Psalms 85:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Mercy and truth
questions.explanation: Psalms 85:10 poetically describes mercy and truth meeting, and righteousness and peace kissing, highlighting the harmony of divine attributes. This is consistent with biblical theology emphasizing God's mercy and truth (Exodus 34:6, Zechariah 8:16-17, John 1:17, Romans 3:25-26).

questions.question: According to Psalms 85:11, where shall truth and righteousness come from?
options: Truth shall spring out of the earth; righteousness shall look down from heaven
Truth and righteousness shall come from the sea
Truth shall come from men; righteousness from angels
Truth and righteousness shall come from the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Truth shall spring out of the earth; righteousness shall look down from heaven
questions.explanation: The Psalmist envisions a divine convergence of truth and righteousness from earth and heaven, symbolizing God’s comprehensive justice and faithfulness (Isaiah 45:8, Jeremiah 23:5, Matthew 5:45, Philippians 2:9-11).

questions.question: What does Psalms 85:12 say the LORD will give, and what will the land do as a result?
options: The LORD shall give that which is good; and our land shall yield her increase
The LORD shall withhold blessings; and the land shall wither
The LORD shall give judgment; and the land shall suffer
The LORD shall give trials; and the land shall be barren
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD shall give that which is good; and our land shall yield her increase
questions.explanation: This verse expresses God’s promise of blessing and productivity, consistent with themes of divine provision (Deuteronomy 28:12, Psalm 67:6, Isaiah 30:23, Matthew 7:11).

questions.question: What role does righteousness play according to Psalms 85:13?
options: Righteousness shall go before him and set us in the way of his steps
questions.correctAnswer: Righteousness shall go before him and set us in the way of his steps
questions.explanation: Righteousness is portrayed as a guide, leading God's people in His path, reflecting biblical imagery of God’s righteousness directing His covenant people (Isaiah 11:5, Psalm 23:3, Proverbs 4:18, 1 John 2:1).

questions.question: Psalms 85:2 states God has forgiven the iniquity of His people and covered their sin. What theological doctrine does this primarily illustrate?
questions.correctAnswer: God’s forgiveness and atonement
questions.explanation: The forgiveness and covering of sin highlight God’s atoning mercy, foundational in biblical theology (Isaiah 53:5, Hebrews 9:22, 1 John 1:9, Romans 5:8). It reflects God’s gracious pardon and covenant faithfulness.

questions.question: How does Psalms 85:3 describe God's response to His own wrath?
options: He has taken away all His wrath and turned from the fierceness of His anger
He has hidden His wrath forever
questions.correctAnswer: He has taken away all His wrath and turned from the fierceness of His anger
questions.explanation: This verse reveals God’s capacity to relent and show mercy, consistent with His attribute of patience and long-suffering (Exodus 34:6-7, Jonah 4:2, Nahum 1:3, Romans 2:4).

questions.question: What question does the Psalmist ask about God's anger in Psalms 85:5?
options: Wilt thou be angry with us forever and draw out thine anger to all generations?
Will you reward us with joy forever?
Will you hide your face from us always?
Will you make us kings over nations?
questions.correctAnswer: Wilt thou be angry with us forever and draw out thine anger to all generations?
questions.explanation: The Psalmist appeals against perpetual divine wrath, expressing hope for God’s mercy and a break in judgment (Lamentations 3:22-23, Isaiah 54:7, Ezekiel 18:23, 2 Peter 3:9).

questions.question: What is the significance of hearing 'what God the LORD will speak' in Psalms 85:8?
options: God will speak peace to His people
God will speak confusion and fear
God will speak only to angels
questions.correctAnswer: God will speak peace to His people
questions.explanation: Hearing God’s word is tied to receiving peace and guidance, important themes in both Old and New Testaments (Isaiah 55:3, John 10:27, Romans 10:17, Philippians 4:7).

questions.question: In Psalms 85:9, to whom is salvation said to be near?
questions.correctAnswer: Them that fear him
questions.explanation: Salvation is promised to those who fear God, emphasizing reverence and obedience as prerequisites (Psalm 34:18, Proverbs 14:26, Acts 10:35, Hebrews 12:28).

questions.question: What does the phrase 'righteousness and peace have kissed each other' in Psalms 85:10 symbolize?
options: The harmony and unity of God's moral attributes
The conflict between justice and mercy
The separation of law and grace
questions.correctAnswer: The harmony and unity of God's moral attributes
questions.explanation: This poetic expression illustrates the perfect blending of God’s justice and mercy, a theme echoed in Romans 3:26, Micah 6:8, and James 3:18, emphasizing divine harmony and reconciliation.

questions.question: According to Psalms 85:7, what two things does the Psalmist ask God to show and grant?
questions.correctAnswer: Show mercy and grant salvation
questions.explanation: The Psalmist requests God’s compassion and deliverance, which are central to salvation history (Exodus 34:6, Psalm 103:8, Ephesians 2:4-5, Titus 3:5). Mercy and salvation are inseparably linked in Scripture.
